p: This second series of experiments was aimed to determine possible synergistic or antagonistic activity of combination of carvacrol and thymol. Based on the fixed ratio method, four different ratios of thymol-carvacrol, i.e., 4:1, 3:2, 2:3, and 1:4 v/ v, were tested for their combinational toxicity on eggs and larvae of Cx. pipiens. The method by Pastor et al. [ 57] was followed; for each ratio, two-fold serial dilutions were performed to give final concentrations ranging from 1 to 100 mg/L. Three replicates were performed for each combination ratio.
